worklogs.comment:
wesm opened a new pull request #2453: WIP ARROW-3075: [C++] Merge parquet-cpp codebase into Arrow C++ codebase
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2453
 
 
   This patch does most of the hard work. I will synchronize the actual code with the Parquet codebase once we're ready to pull the trigger. I'm going to push a corresponding branch in parquet-cpp so it's easier to rebase the changes before rsync-ing them into the Arrow codebase
   
   Some notes
   
   * We still need to have a vote about this on the Arrow mailing list
   * I do not think that we should merge the git history into Apache Arrow. This would cause commits to show up in multiple repos and generally cause confusion. The downside of this is that when we want to `git blame` we'll have to look back in the original codebase. I'm OK with that
   * I will change the author of these commits to be dev@parquet.apache.org so it is not attributed to me
   * Still need to incorporate with Travis CI / Appveyor
   * Parquet has a lot of build flags; some of these will basically need to get redone. Because there are no tests for these build configurations, it's very hard to test all the permutations here. I suggest we add Dockerfiles that simulate the different build modes (minimal / header-only dependencies, etc.)
   * We will need to add more CMake targets to modularize the build in follow up commits. I'd like to write "ninja parquet" and only build Parquet core
   * The Boost Thirdparty stuff is a mess. We should create a follow up issue to refactor / clean that up
   
   cc @pitrou @cpcloud @joshuastorck @cpcloud @majetideepak @xhochy 

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

wesm commented on issue #2453: WIP ARROW-3075: [C++] Merge parquet-cpp codebase into Arrow C++ codebase
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2453#issuecomment-417960238
 
 
   @xhochy I stand awaiting instructions about how to proceed with the merge. My preference is to squash the history and, while we are at it, move the data files to http://github.com/apache/arrow-testing.
   
   According to https://stackoverflow.com/a/15802324 through some trickery we can graft the src/parquet commit history onto the Arrow repo to be able to do an `--ff-merge`. If we are collectively OK with the idea of pulling ~400 commits into the Arrow repo then we could do this.
   
   If we pull in the commit history with `filter-branch`, one question is what to do with the early "unclean" commits (no JIRAs) 
   
   I can't claim to speak for @nongli but I suspect he wouldn't mind if we squashed these pre-Apache commits as the seed of the project. 
   
   ```
   * 592cf71 2015-04-02 | PARQUET-232: minor compilation issue [Fabrizio Fabbri]
   * db20bae 2014-09-08 | Add "parquet_reader.cc" in the folder "example". [Yue Chen]
   * bce89a0 2014-10-28 | PARQUET-120: Copy dev scripts and readme from parquet-mr. [Nong Li]
   * f23be56 2014-06-04 | Fix broken download_thirdparty script. [Nong Li]
   * 153f92b 2014-06-03 | Add apache license. [Nong Li]
   * 09d3c74 2014-06-02 | Switch to int64. [Nong Li]
   * bfe23da 2014-06-02 | Add lz4 codec. [Nong Li]
   * aa09914 2014-06-02 | Added a quick snappy & plain benchmark. [Nong Li]
   * 143a868 2014-05-31 | Add thrift generated sources. [Nong Li]
   * df3c37a 2014-05-31 | Implement snappy decompression. [Nong Li]
   * dedad16 2014-05-31 | Abstraction for compression. [Nong Li]
   * 0da0397 2014-05-31 | Move encoding to own folder. [Nong Li]
   * 9a9125f 2014-05-31 | Add a plain encoded test file and some misc documentation. [Nong Li]
   * e8be46d 2014-05-31 | Updated readme. [Nong Li]
   * ef57939 2014-05-31 | Fix off by one in delta bit pack encoding. [Nong Li]
   * 48591fd 2014-05-30 | fix core-dump while reading PLAIN_ENCODING; fix readNewPage to return page instead of the last one [Jaguar Xiong]
   * 846e6b4 2014-05-27 | Fix max encoded size estimate in RLE encoding. [Nong Li]
   * 46f5b52 2014-05-23 | Update readme. [Nong Li]
   * 104373f 2014-05-23 | Move encodings to separate files. [Nong Li]
   * 078bb78 2014-05-23 | Implement delta byte length and delta string encodings. [Nong Li]
   * e214cb4 2014-05-22 | Fix delta binary encoding. Decodes at about ~200M/sec. [Nong Li]
   * c656554 2014-05-22 | Cleanup bitpacking encoding. Add delta length encoding. [Nong Li]
   * 992f187 2014-05-20 | Initial implementation of delta binary packing. [Nong Li]
   * 722c751 2014-05-19 | Added simple decode benchmark. [Nong Li]
   * 0959d2a 2014-05-19 | Inline some simple functions. [Nong Li]
   * c23d93a 2014-05-19 | Change decoders to a batched API. [Nong Li]
   * bc84379 2014-05-18 | Remove makefile. [Nong Li]
   * 0ac13db 2014-05-18 | Update readme. [Nong Li]
   * c19c5a7 2014-05-18 | Plumb through all the types. [Nong Li]
   * 060c0d7 2014-05-18 | Better decoder management. [Nong Li]
   * 9f1d702 2014-05-17 | Fix stream abstraction. [Nong Li]
   * 674a392 2014-05-13 | Read a dictionary encoded int column. [Nong Li]
   * f979b15 2014-05-13 | Implement some encodings. [Nong Li]
   * f1b987e 2014-05-13 | Include some Impala utility code. [Nong Li]
   * 9b42064 2014-05-13 | Can read the dictionary for ints. [Nong Li]
   * eb10a21 2014-05-12 | Move build to cmake. [Nong Li]
   * 01c30aa 2014-05-12 | Initial classes. [Nong Li]
   * 08acdf6 2014-05-12 | Initial commit [Nong Li]
   ```

   Looking at this -- I will go ahead and create a script to make the grafted history, and then we can decide to squash or not squash when we are about to pull the trigger on merging. 
   
   Here's the branch where I have the modifications to the Parquet codebase that you see here
   
   https://github.com/wesm/parquet-cpp/tree/arrow-merge

wesm commented on issue #2453: WIP ARROW-3075: [C++] Merge parquet-cpp codebase into Arrow C++ codebase
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2453#issuecomment-417963389
 
 
   Here is the scrubbed, moved source directory:
   
   https://github.com/wesm/parquet-cpp-merging
   
   Here are the commands I used to create it:
   
   ```
   # Remove everything except src/parquet
   git filter-branch -f --tree-filter "find . -not -path './.git' -not -path './.git/*' -not -path './src' -not -path './src/parquet' -not -path './src/parquet/*' -delete" --prune-empty
   
   # Move src/parquet to cpp/src/parquet
   git filter-branch -f --tree-filter 'mkdir -p cpp/src && test -d src/parquet && mv src/parquet cpp/src/parquet || echo "Nothing to do"' HEAD
   ```
   
   Still want to squash the remaining early commits. I will rebase these commits and Arrow master now and push them here

----------------------------------------------------------------

wesm commented on issue #2453: WIP ARROW-3075: [C++] Merge parquet-cpp codebase into Arrow C++ codebase
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2453#issuecomment-417964005
 
 
   OK, now we have a linear history with only the commit data touching the `src/parquet` source tree.
   
   The only thing slight unsatisfying about what is here is that the _committer_ (but not the author) is changed to be me. Through some more git magic this can be fixed, or by writing a script to cherry pick one commit at a time. I'm going to stop here to get some feedback before I do this

kszucs commented on issue #2453: WIP ARROW-3075: [C++] Merge parquet-cpp codebase into Arrow C++ codebase
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2453#issuecomment-418105735
 
 
   Merging parquet-cpp/master increases arrow's size by ~4MB. Filter branch indeed rewrites the hashes, but simply moving the files doesn't. The most straightforward way would be `moving -> git merge --allow-unrelated-histories`, but You probably see the long term disadvantages of that better than I do.

----------------------------------------------------------------

xhochy commented on a change in pull request #2453: WIP ARROW-3075: [C++] Merge parquet-cpp codebase into Arrow C++ codebase
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2453#discussion_r214701044
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/cmake_modules/BuildUtils.cmake
 ##########
 @@ -126,7 +126,7 @@ function(ADD_ARROW_LIB LIB_NAME)
 
   set(RUNTIME_INSTALL_DIR bin)
 
-  if (ARROW_BUILD_SHARED)
+  if (${ARROW_BUILD_SHARED})
 
 Review comment:
   The difference is that the old version is the variable/variable-name and the new one is the content of the variable. In the case of `if` this is irrelevant but matters at many more places.
